conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and geometry.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast behind the objects.
Light source is positioned in front of the objects.
Moving the light source forward changes the angle of light rays.
Shadows will shift closer to the objects as the light source moves closer.
Shadows will decrease in size with the light source closer.
Shadow A moves closer to the glove and becomes smaller.
Shadow B moves closer to the typewriter and becomes smaller.
Shadow C moves closer to the crab and becomes smaller.
Shadow D moves closer to the peaches and becomes smaller.
Final answer: Shadows shift closer to objects and decrease in size.
